definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
circle/ring/loop/classifier for loops, orbits, laps of race etc/CL:個|个[ge4]/to surround/to circle
to confine/to lock up/to pen in

sentences.english: These readings are obtained from a Japanese magnetosphere simulator.
sentences.chinese: 這些讀數來源於“日本磁氣圈模擬器”。

sentences.english: This planet, we think, is likely to have a fairly  substantial atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 我們認爲，這顆行星可能具有相當厚密的大氣圈。

sentences.english: The balloon control-rings used in ring frames divide the spinning balloon into two parts:the upper one and the lower one.
sentences.chinese: 環錠細紗機安裝氣圈環後將形成上下兩段氣圈。

sentences.english: The balloon control-rings used in ring frames divide the spinning balloon into two parts:the upper one and the lower one.
sentences.chinese: 環錠細紗機安裝氣圈環後將形成上下兩段氣圈。

sentences.english: These scientists pay close attention to the changes in the atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 這幾位科學家密切關注着大氣圈的變化。

sentences.english: The atmosphere is a continuous layer of gases.
sentences.chinese: 大氣圈是連續的氣體層。

definition: horizontal bar to hold a door closed (made of wood or metal)/door bolt
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
to bore/to burrow/to crawl through a tunnel
